item.title: Shooters Fes 2025 schedule announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/shooters-fes-2025-schedule-announced

A weekend of shoot 'em ups.

City Connection has announced the live stream schedule for shoot ’em up games event Shooters Fes 2025, which will run from June 14 to 15 at Mikado Game Center in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan.

Here is the full schedule of events, which will be live streamed on YouTube:

(All times are Japan Standard Time.)

June 14

  • 12:00 to 13:00 – Opening + Secret Title – To be announced.
  • 13:00 to 14:00 – Sonic Wings Reunion – To be announced.
  • 14:00 to 15:00 – G-MODE Archives+ Armored Core Mobile 2 – Featuring G-MODE Archives producer Koichi Takeshita and director Yuki Hatta.
  • 15:00 to 16:00 – Tatsujin Extreme – Featuring Tatsujin game metal guitarist Hirohiko Atobe.
  • 16:00 to 17:00 – R-Type Tactics I • II Cosmos – Featuring Granzella chief producer and game designer Kazuma Kujo.
  • 17:00 to 18:00 – Earthion – Featuring Ancient development director Makoto Wada, Ancient president and CEO Yuzo Koshiro, and Superdeluxe Games studio manager KAORI.
  • 18:00 to 19:00 – Operation Night Strikers – Featuring TAITO producer Yuichi Toyama, TAITO and ZUNTATA sound designer Katsuhisa Ishikawa, M2 president Naoki Horii, and M2 public relations representative Hibana Yokeru.
  • 19:00 to 20:00 – Gradius ORIGINS – Featuring M2 president Naoki Horii, M2ShotTriggers general director Kazuki Kubota, M2 public relations representative Hibana Yokeru, and Konami producer Ryosaku Ueno.
  • 20:00 to 21:00 – Zaleste – Featuring production development group / production department manager Hiroshi Aoki, production development group / marketing manager Rank-and-File Employee Dogoo, and M2 president Naoki Horii.
  • 21:00 to 22:00 – Alice Gear Aegis – Featuring Alice Gear Aegis development director Junichi Kashiwagi, operations director Jun Kaga, and script director Yuuichi Imamura.
  • 22:00 to 23:00 – Moss: Coming Soon – To be announced.

June 15

  • 12:00 to 13:00 – Toaplan Arcade Collection Vol. 1 / Toaplan Arcade Collection Vol. 2 – To be announced.
  • 13:00 to 14:00 – Final Formation – To be announced.
  • 14:00 to 15:00 – Earthion exA Label – Featuring exA-Arcadia / AM development department president Eric Chung, voice actor Charlie, exA-Arcadia AM development’s James, MOF, TRP, and ADR, Cosmo Machia president Kazunobu Mori, Ancient president and CEO Yuzo Koshiro, and STUDIO Hisekutta mangaka and illustrator Junya Inoue.
  • 15:00 to 16:00 – Cotton Reboot! High Tension! – Featuring BEEP producer RF-Maruyama and voice actor Charlie.
  • 16:00 – Mebius: Coming Soon – To be announced.
  • 17:00 to 18:30 – Snow Bros. Special Anniversary Edition / Snow Bros. 2 Special / G’AIM’E x Time Crisis – Featuring Happinet unofficial public relations representatives Nick and Tom, and Tassei Denki public relations representatives Richard Fukumoto and Rachel Nakahara.
  • 19:00 to 20:00 – NeverAwake Downloadable Content “Flashback” – Featuring Neotro‘s Hiroshi Sawatari and Phoenixx events manager Yamaguchi.
  • 20:00 to 21:00 – Mamorukun ReCurse! – To be announced.
  • 21:00 to 22:00 – Grand Finale – To be announced.

item.title: SHIFT UP’s Project Witches becomes Project Spirits, now recruiting development staff
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/shift-ups-project-witches-becomes-project-spirits-now-recruiting-development-staff

The company's next flagship property following Stellar Blade and NIKKE.

SHIFT UP has revealed that its upcoming cross-platform title, previously code-named Project Witches, will now be known as Project Spirits. The studio describes the game as a subculture title that “embraces the theme of ‘Eastern Fantasy,'” with a global release planned for 2027.

“Project Spirits is SHIFT UP’s new flagship project, a subculture cross-platform title that embraces the concept of ‘EASTERN Fantasy,'” reads the game’s description on the SHIFT UP website. “As a new [intellectual property] following Stellar Blade and NIKKE, it is currently in development as a top-tier quality game for the industry, building on SHIFT UP’s proven track record and expertise in [intellectual property] creation demonstrated through previous projects.”

SHIFT UP also posted job listings for several Project Spirits development roles, including background artist, battle planner, character artist, lead content planner, level designer, monster artist, previsualization artist, and screenwriter. Among the qualifications are proficiency in Unreal Engine 5, experience in planning Japanese RPGs or anime-style games, and creating open-world environments, large maps, and dungeons.

Here is the new artwork of the project featured on the SHIFT UP website:

Thanks, Ruliweb / SeoulFN.

item.title: Brave x Junction demo now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/brave-x-junction-demo-now-available

  • PC

Try out RideonJapan's blackjack RPG.

RideonJapan has released a demo for blackjack RPG Brave x Junction for PC via Steam. It features English and Japanese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Brave x Junction is an RPG where you battle monsters in a back-and-forth contest of blackjack, the playing card game familiar to many.

Defeat the monsters and delve dungeons. A fun tale of adventure all while being simple to play.

Key Features

  • Blackjack Style Turn-Based Battle System
    • Battles are a one-on-one turn-based system.
    • Who has the closest number to 21 in their hand? They deal an attack to the opponent!
    • Three distinctive playable characters make an appearance: The Fighter, with a head on battle-like creed; the Thief, unrivaled in sensing danger and thwarting it; and the Magician, who employs trickery at will!
    • Leave your strategy to chance? Entrap the enemy with trickery? The way you enjoy is up to you, the player.
  • Diverse Array of Monsters
    • Slimes, orcs, dragons, and monsters, familiar to fantasy RPGs all lurk out of the depths, one after another.
    • Card hand concealing ghosts, trolls that surpass the 21-card value limit, and many more with a diverse array of skills stand in the way of the player.
    • Monsters from Rideon Japan‘s Adventure Bar Story and Mercenaries Saga series games even make an appearance!
  • Loads of Factors to Augment, Unfolding a Blackjack Victory
    • Acquire boost cards as you advance the adventure, strengthening status and learning skills.
    • Abilities come along with some weapons and accessories, and at the Armory & Forge in town, synthesis can allow for unbound customization.
    • Combining skills with abilities? This could bring to life new tactics.
    • Can you traverse the untrodden dungeons? It’s all up to you, the player!

A release date for Brave x Jucntion has yet to be announced.

item.title: This Week’s Japanese Game Releases: Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/this-weeks-japanese-game-releases-switch-2

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Mario Kart World, Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD Remaster, Yakuza 0 Director's Cut, and more.

Switch 2 and its lineup of launch titles are the highlights of this week’s Japanese video game releases. The hardware is launching alongside the anticipated Mario Kart World, as well as Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD Remaster, Cyberpunk 2077, Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma, Shine Post: Be Your Idol!, Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut, and more.

Outside of Switch 2, new titles due out this week include Natsume’s Book of Friends: Hazuki no Shirushi for Switch and PC, Illvelo Swamp Happy Together for Switch, and Zenless Zone Zero for Xbox Series.

Get the full list of this week’s Japanese game releases below. It should be noted that Gematsu will receive a small percentage of money from purchases made through Play-Asia links. You can also save five percent with our multi-use “GEMATSU2025” coupon code.

Hardware

  • Switch 2
    • Asian Version
  • Switch 2 + Mario Kart World Bundle
    • Asian Version

Physical and Digital

  • Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD Remaster (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
  • Cyberpunk 2077: Ultimate Edition (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Hogwarts Legacy (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Illvelo Swamp Happy Together (Switch)
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching digitally worldwide.
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Mario Kart World (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Natsume’s Book of Friends: Hazuki no Shirushi (Switch)
    • Limited Edition (Switch)
  • Nobunaga’s Ambition: Awakening Complete Edition (PS5, Switch 2) – Game-key card on Switch 2. Launching digitally worldwide.
  • Puyo Puyo Tetris 2S (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (Switch, Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version
      • Standard Edition (Switch, Switch 2)
      • Limited Edition (Switch)
    • European Version
      • Standard Edition (Switch, Switch 2)
      • Limited Edition (Switch)
    • Asian Version (Switch, Switch 2)
  • Shine Post: Be Your Idol! (Switch 2) – Game-key card.
  • Side Kicks! beyond (Switch)
    • Deluxe Edition (Switch)
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
  • Split Fiction (Switch 2) – Code in a box. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Street Fighter 6 Years 1-2 Fighters Edition (PS5, Switch 2, PS4) – Game-key card on Switch 2. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4)
    • European Version (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PS4)
    • Asian Version (PS5, Switch 2, PS4)
  • Suikoden I & II HD Remaster: Gate Rune and Dunan Unification Wars (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching digitally worldwide.
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)
  • Survival Kids (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching digitally worldwide.
  • Suuran Digit for Nintendo Switch (Switch)
    • Special Edition (Switch)
  • Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut (Switch 2) – Game-key card. Launching worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2)
    • European Version (Switch 2)
    • Asian Version (Switch 2)

Digital-Only

  • Arcade Archives Ridge Racer (PS4, Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Arcade Archives 2 Ridge Racer (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • DELTARUNE (PS5, Switch 2, PS4, Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Etheria: Restart (PC [Steam], iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.
  • FANTASY LIFE i: The Girl Who Steals – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • Fast Fusion (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • Fortnite (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • Gal Guardians: Servants of the Dark (Xbox Series, Xbox One) – Launching worldwide.
  • HITMAN World of Assassination Signature Edition (Switch 2) – Launching physically worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2) – Game-key card.
  • Juufuutei Raden’s Guide for Pixel Museum (Switch, PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Natsume’s Book of Friends: Hazuki no Shirushi (PC [Steam])
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Welcome Tour (Switch 2) – Launching worldwide.
  • The Red Bell’s Lament (Switch) – Launching worldwide.
  • Rise of Industry 2 (PS5, Xbox Series, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma (PC [Steam]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Sid Meier’s Civilization VII – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Switch 2) – Launching physically worldwide.
    • North American Version (Switch 2) – Code in a box.
    • European Version (Switch 2) – Code in a box.
  • Street Fighter 6 Years 1-2 Fighters Edition (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.
  • Zenless Zone Zero (Xbox Series) – Launching worldwide.

The PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch titles listed above can be purchased through Japanese PlayStation Network and Nintendo accounts using prepaid cards:

  • PlayStation Store cards (yen): 1,100 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 10,000
  • Nintendo eShop cards (yen): 1,000 / 1,500 / 3,000 / 5,000 / 9,000

Demos, Betas, Updates, etc.

  • Splitgate 2 Open Beta (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC [Steam, Epic Games Store]) – Launching worldwide.
  • Zenless Zone Zero Version 2.0 Update “Where Clouds Embrace the Dawn” (PS5, Xbox Series, PC, iOS, Android) – Launching worldwide.

item.title: People Can Fly cancels Square Enix-published Project Gemini, VR game Project Bifrost
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/people-can-fly-cancels-square-enix-published-project-gemini-vr-game-project-bifrost

"As a result, we have to significantly regroup as a studio and scale down our teams."

People Can Fly has canceled two in-development projects—the Square Enix-published Project Gemini and the self-published virtual reality game Project Bifrost—and will lay off staff as a result, studio CEO Sebastian Wojciechowski said in a message.

The developer is also working on Gears of War: E-Day in cooperation with The Coalition, and Project Delta in cooperation with Sony Interactive Entertainment.

Here is the full message from Wojciechowski:

Today we made a very difficult decision to suspend the development of Project Gemini and Project Bifrost—the relevant current reports have been released to the market.

The suspension of the Gemini project is a consequence of the fact that the Publisher has not presented us with a draft of the subsequent content rider to the Publishing Agreement covering the terms and conditions of further milestones on project Gemini and the lack of communication from the Publisher as to its willingness to continue or terminate the Gemini project.

Project Bifrost was suspended due to the above and the analysis of the Group’s cash flow, which showed a lack of prospects for securing organizational resources and funds necessary to continue the production and release of this project.

As a result, we have to significantly regroup as a studio and scale down our teams, which hurts the most.

We wish to express our deepest regret and sadness over how these events have unfolded and our sincere gratitude for everyone’s contribution up to this point.

—Sebastian Wojciechowski, CEO

item.title: The World Ends with You director Tatsuya Kando leaves Square Enix after 29 years
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/06/the-world-ends-with-you-director-tatsuya-kando-leaves-square-enix-after-29-years

'I will continue doing my best going forward.'

Tatsuya Kando has left Square Enix after 29 years, he announced on Twitter.

Kando most notably served as the director of The World Ends with You, The World Ends with You: Solo Remix, Final Fantasy: All The Bravest, and The World Ends with You: Final Remix, as well as series director of NEO: The World Ends with You. Outside of directorial roles, he was an animation supervisor on numerous Kingdom Hearts games, as well as various Final Fantasy games.

“This is a personal matter, but as of May 31, I have left Square Enix,” Kando said in a message. “Over the past 29 years, I’ve had the opportunity to work on many projects, including Final Fantasy, Kingdom Hearts, and The World Ends with You, and the experiences I’ve gained are irreplaceable.

“The support from everyone who played the games has been incredibly encouraging, and it served as a driving force that pushed me forward in development every day. I’m deeply grateful. Thank you so much!

“Going forward, I will continue doing my best to create enjoyable content that brings smiles to everyone’s faces.”
